alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 9:48PM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PDT Wednesday, May 17 the stage was 10.12 feet. - Forecast...The Merced river a Pohono is expected to crest at 10.8 feet by 4:00 AM PDT Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 06/05/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 945 AM PDT.
